question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Be sure to ensure that the code you generate is executable and can be displayed. Please help me implement this SVG image using code: a white sign with the YouTube logo on it.

checklist.title: Is the SVG code structure correctly implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the SVG code includes proper namespace declarations, viewBox settings, and a well-structured document. Check if the SVG element hierarchy follows best practices (e.g., grouping related elements with <g> tags, using descriptive IDs). Score 0 if SVG is not implemented at all, 5 if basic structure exists with minor issues, and 10 if structure is perfect with proper organization.

checklist.title: Is the YouTube logo accurately reproduced?
checklist.description: Evaluate how accurately the YouTube logo is recreated, including proper proportions, rounded corners, and the play button symbol. The logo should match YouTube's official design specifications. Deduct 3 points if proportions are incorrect, 3 points if the play button is misshapen, and 5 points if the overall shape deviates significantly from the official logo. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the white sign properly designed?
checklist.description: Check if the white sign background is properly implemented with appropriate dimensions, color (#FFFFFF), and shape (likely rectangular with possible rounded corners). Evaluate whether the sign provides sufficient contrast for the YouTube logo. Deduct 3 points if the dimensions are inappropriate, 3 points if the color is off-white or has transparency issues, and 5 points if the sign shape is poorly executed. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the color scheme correctly implemented?
checklist.description: Verify that the YouTube logo uses the correct red color (#FF0000) for the main rectangle and pure white (#FFFFFF) for the play triangle. The sign background should be white with appropriate border/shadow if included. Deduct 5 points for incorrect YouTube red, 3 points for wrong play button color, and 5 points for inappropriate background color treatment. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle different viewport sizes and browser compatibility issues. Check for the use of responsive techniques (preserveAspectRatio attribute, percentage-based dimensions, viewBox scaling). Code with strong robustness should work across major browsers and adapt to different contexts, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no scalability or compatibility considerations are made, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Hover animations 2. Click interactions 3. Gradient effects or subtle shadows). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Unnecessary nested elements or groups 2. Unused attributes or styles 3. Overly complex paths that could be simplified. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core SVG rendering is affected by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review proper code organization (such as separating structure, presentation, and behavior), effective use of SVG attributes vs. CSS styling, and code readability with appropriate comments. Deduct 5 points for mixing styling concerns inappropriately; deduct 3 points if the code lacks comments or documentation; deduct 3 points if variable naming is unclear or inconsistent. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Proportional scaling of the logo relative to the sign 2) Proper whitespace margins around the logo (at least 10% of logo width) 3) Professional finish with attention to detail (smooth curves, aligned elements). Deduct 3 points for improper spacing, 5 points for misaligned elements, and 5 points for poor curve quality or jagged edges. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the implementation optimized for performance?
checklist.description: Judge whether the SVG implementation is optimized for performance: 1) Minimal use of filters and complex effects 2) Appropriate precision in path coordinates (not excessive decimal places) 3) Use of simple shapes instead of complex paths where appropriate. Deduct 3 points for unnecessarily complex paths, 3 points for excessive precision in coordinates, and 5 points for using computationally expensive effects unnecessarily. The full score is 10 points.
